issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares Farm.addAnimal(animal: Animal):boolean (returns boolean) but the reference solution implements addAnimal(Animal) with a void return type. The template repository also leaves Farm unimplemented (TODO) which means students will follow the UML or the textual description; the conflicting return type (boolean vs. void) can confuse students about which signature to implement and may cause tests to fail if one expectation is used in automated checks.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the addAnimal method return type consistent across artifacts. Either update the problem statement UML to show addAnimal(animal: Animal):void (and clarify in text that it just adds the animal) or change the solution (and template stub) so addAnimal returns boolean (e.g., public boolean addAnimal(Animal animal) { return animals.add(animal); }). Keep all three artifacts (problem UML/text, template, solution) aligned to avoid student confusion.
